string-array.name: exp_akshaypatra
string-array.item: ISKCON : Gods at Work : Feeding millions of School Going Kids
The Akshaya Patra Foundation, a non-profit organization with the vision that no child shall be deprived of education because of hunger, runs the largest midday meal program in the world
https://karnataka.akshayapatra.org/

string-array.name: exp_betta
string-array.item: Walk/Pedal With Family and connect to nature
travellers will get the chance to see the beautiful view of the cities of Hubli and Dharwad.
It is situated on Unkal Hills in Hubli.
They can also visit a Devi Temple that is situated on top of Nrupatunga Betta.
visitors can have a birds eye view of the airport in the west and Amargol in the north.
This site is an ideal spot for people who want to spend time away from the chaotic urban life

string-array.name: exp_chandramouleshwara
string-array.item: Time Travel to a place built 900 years ago from the Badami Chalukyan era
It was built on the lines of Badami, Aihole and Pattadakal temples, is a Monument of National Importance
Unlike other Shiva temples in the North Karnataka region, the Chandramouleshwar Temple has four doors in as many directions, altogether accounting for twelve doors in the temple
Besides two Shivalingams and two Naandi statutes at the entrance.
One of the two lingams is the "Chaturmukha Lingam", a four-faced Shiva lingam, which is the speciality of the temple

string-array.name: exp_chennamma
string-array.item: Bearing witness to the glorious past, the Kittur Rani Channamma Circle is key landmark of Hubli. Popularly known as Traffic I-Land, this spot attracts many travelers owing to the imposing statue of Rani Channamma erected right at the city center. Scores of visitors flock to this circle at all hours of the day to pay their homage to the great queen, making it the busiest junction in town. Step into the famous Idgah Maidan situated adjacent to the circle and catch a glimpse of its verdant surroundings. Do not forget to try the famous Dharwad Peda which is available at restaurants and food stalls lining the narrow streets of this bustling locality. Historical Context: This area is named after the brave warrior, Rani Channamma, who single-handedly fought against the British.
The Divine Warrior Female Forces
